evidence: Medical history search for CNS metastases, brain metastases, leptomeningeal disease, and spinal cord metastases returned no matches
No neurological symptoms or conditions found in medical history (seizures, headaches, focal deficits, etc.)
Concomitant medications search shows subject is NOT on corticosteroids (dexamethasone was in summary but not found in active medications via tool)
No anti-epileptic medications found in current medication regimen
Tumor assessments show progression with new lesions but no specific mention of CNS involvement
Progressive disease noted on 2024-12-10 with new lesions, but location not specified as CNS
results.reasoning: Subject 101-001 does NOT meet the exclusion criterion for 'Active or symptomatic central nervous system metastases.' The comprehensive search of medical history found no evidence of: (1) CNS metastases of any type (brain, leptomeningeal, spinal cord), (2) neurological symptoms suggestive of CNS involvement, or (3) medications typically used to manage CNS metastases (corticosteroids for symptom control or anti-epileptics). While the subject has progressive NSCLC with new lesions as of December 2024, there is no evidence these new lesions involve the central nervous system. The absence of supportive care medications (steroids, anti-seizure drugs) further supports that any CNS involvement is unlikely.
results.recommendation: Subject 101-001 does not meet exclusion criterion EXCL-002. However, given the recent progressive disease with new lesions (December 2024), recommend ensuring that imaging assessments specifically evaluated for CNS involvement and that this was documented. If CNS imaging was not performed as part of recent progression assessment, consider brain MRI to definitively rule out CNS metastases given advanced disease stage.
